title: Edit a SACM service component record
content:
Note: If Native SACM is enabled, as soon as you save the changes made to a service component record, the corresponding attributes of the CI are updated in UCMDB as well. 

Each actual service contains one or more service components. Each service component can support one or more actual services.

The service component and the actual service represent the business service logic of the organization in the Service Asset and Configuration Management data model.

You can edit a service component record to add new information or change existing information.

You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right. For more information, see Mass update.

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration.

  2. From SACM Home, select Service Components.

  3. Select the service component record you want to edit or view.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

    Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

  4. Click the tab you want to view or edit. The General tab is displayed by default.

    Tab Description
    General Displays details about the SACM component.
    Workflow Displays the workflow metaphase and phase for the selected record.
    Related CIs

    Displays links to other SACM components.

    Note: Data domain segmentation also applies to related CIs. That is, if the currently logged-in user doesn't have access to some related CIs' data domains, these CI records are hidden from the user.

    When Native SACM is disabled, you can create new relationships with:

    • Actual services
    • System elements or devices
    When Native SACM is enabled, see CI relationship federation.
    Discussions Displays any relevant conversations about the selected record. For more information about discussions, see Discussions.
    History Displays changes to the selected record. For more information about history, see History.
  5. Click   Save on the toolbar.
